etymology.description: Evolved geometrically from 胄; earlier written as 毓 for this pronunciation.
etymology.interpretation: In Han times, scribes regularized the graph of 胄 into a more geometric form that became 育. Earlier, the yù reading and its ‘nurture/bring up’ sense were written with 毓, which 育 later came to represent in standard usage.

examples.chinese: 国家重视教育改革(國家重視教育改革)。
examples.english: The country attaches great importance to education reform.

examples.chinese: 父母细心地抚育孩子长大(父母細心地撫育孩子長大)。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ xìxīn de fǔyù háizi zhǎngdà.
examples.english: Parents carefully raise their children to adulthood.

examples.chinese: 这位老师致力于培育学生的创造力(這位老師致力於培育學生的創造力)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi lǎoshī zhìlì yú péiyù xuéshēng de chuàngzàolì.
examples.english: This teacher is dedicated to cultivating students’ creativity.
